remarks: Define the adjoint of a Hilbert space operator (if it exists).  The domain of ` adjh ` is the set of all adjoint operators.  Definition of adjoint in [Kalmbach2] p. 8.  Unlike Kalmbach (and most authors), we do not demand that the operator be linear, but instead show (in ~ adjbdln ) that the adjoint exists for a bounded linear operator.  (Contributed by NM, 20-Feb-2006.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
df-adjh $p |- adjh = { <. t , u >. | ( t : ~H --> ~H /\ u : ~H --> ~H /\ A. x e. ~H A. y e. ~H ( ( t ` x ) .ih y ) = ( x .ih ( u ` y ) ) ) } $.
$d t u x y $.
